note: Title from colophon (f. 49v). Title given in text (f. 2r) is Spandārthasūtrāvalī. Title page (f. 1r) reads Saṭīkāspandavivṛtiprārabhā.|Copied by a brāhmaṇa named Rājānakanidhāna in Kāśī.|Written 13-18 lines per leaf.|Good condition. The first several leaves have come loose from the binding. Part of the text is in brown ink. Mistakes are covered over with yellow, blotched out with black, or indicated by 2 horizontal lines above the syllable in question. Many of the Spandasūtras and some words are highlighted with orange powder. Significant marginal additions.|Begins: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ. daśādikkālāghair akalitacidālokavapuṣaḥ sadā tādṛḱsvātmānubhavitṛtayāvisphuritayaḥ. nijodharmaḥ śaṁbhor anupamacamatkārasarasaḥ paraṁ ́sāktaṁ tattvaṁ jayati jagati spanda iti tat.|Colophon, ff. 49v-50r: saṁpūrṇeyaṁ vṛtyanusāriṇī spandavivṛttiḥ kṛtis tatrabhavato mahāmh̄eśvarācāryaśiromaṇirājānakaśrīmadutpaladevānujīvino rājānakaśrīrāmasyeti śivam. likhitaṁ mayā rājānanidhānākhyavipreṇa svātmamaheśvaravinodārtham kāśyāṁ madhye trilocanacaraṇakamalasamīpe sthitvā pilapilākṣetranivāsamānena śrīgurubālārkasadṛśakāntābālakarāmākhyapreraṇayā likhitaṁ mayā. śrīparamaśivārpaṇam astu. saṁvat 1877 caitramāse kṛṣṇapakṡe amāvasyāṁ somavāsare sampūrṇam iti śubham astu sarvajagatāṁ.

note: The Śivanāmakalpalatālavāla of Bhāskararāya, with an incomplete commentary, Sudhāpū [Sudhāpūra], by Veṅkaṭācalasūri [Veṅkaṭācalapaṇḍita]. Commentary present only on the last portion of the text (ff. 16r-end), subsequent to the exposition on the 108 names of Śiva.|Title Śivanāmakalpalatālavāla from colophon of commentary (f. 19r). Colophon of text (f. 18v) supplies Śivanāmāṣṭaśata as the title. Title of commentary from Aufrecht's Catalogus Catalogorum (2.154) and the critical edition (Śivanāmakalpalatālavāla of Śrī Bhāskararāya ,H. V. Nagaraja Rao, ed., Oriental Research Institute Series, no. 146 [Mysore: Oriental Research Institute, 1985]). The title supplied in the ms. (f. 19r) is Sudhāpū.|Text cataloged incorrectly by Poleman as Śivanāmakalpalatā.|Written 7 lines per leaf.|Good condition. Mistakes indicated by two horizontal lines above the syllable in question. Marginal corrections.|Text begins: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ. mokṣasyaikanidānam avjanayanabrahme[n]dracandrādibhir devaiḥ prāṇapadīkṛtaṁ kalimalapradhvaṁsi dharmāṅkuraḥ bhāratyāpi sudurnirūpamahitrayyantare gopitaṁ vaktuṙmaṅgaladaṁ śiveti vimalaṁ nāmaiva nastārakaṁ (verse 1).|Colophon of text (f. 18v): iti kāśinivāsisāgnicityakratukṛdbhāskararāyabhāratī januṣaḥsaphalatvasi[d]dhaye śivanāmāṣṭaśataṁ vyavarvarīt.|Colophon of commentary (f. 19r): iti śrīveṅkaṭācalasūripraṇītaḥ śivanāmakalpalatālavālasudhāpūḥ samāptaḥ. śrīsāmbasadāśivārpaṇam astuḥ. yādṛśaṁ pustakaṁ dṛṣṭvạ̄ tādṛśaṁ likhitaṁ mayā. yadi śuddham aśuddhaṁ vā mama doṣo na vidyate.

subject_as_recorded: Shaktism|Shaktism|Kashmir Śaivism|Kashmir Śaivism
note: Title written in black in the center of the upper margin of f. 1r, in a hand other than that of the scribe. Title abbreviations "Kāma" or "Kā" appear on upper left margins of numerous folios. UPenn's handwritten catalog notes and New Cat. Cat. identify the text as part of the Rudrayāmala. No justification for this is apparent, and the text is presumably the same Kāmakalāvilāsa described in New Cat. Cat., vol. 3, as "55 Āryā verses on Devī worship by Puṇyānanda (also called Advaitānanda...) of Kashmir, teacher of Amṛtānandanātha."|Written 7-8 lines per leaf, running into the margins on f. 8v.|Good condition. Text written in brown. Some water damage on ff. 7-8. Mistakes covered over with yellow or blotched out with brown. Marginal corrections in black and brown. Pagination errors.|Begins (f. 1r): śrīguruñ jayati om̐ sakalabhuvanodayasthitilayalīlāvinodano[dbhu?]ktaḥ aṁtarlīnavimarśaḥ pātumaheśaḥ prakāśamātratanuḥ 1|Ends (f. 8): dhāraṇāt tasya sūtrasya nochiṣṭo nāśuci bhavet yadātmāprajñayātmānaṁ saṁdhatte paramātmani tena saṁdhyādhyānam ekaṁ tasmāt saṁdhyābhivadanaṁ 5

note: Title from incipit (f. 1v).|Selection of Tantric works with titles including: Bhūtaśuddhiprāṇapratiṣṭhā (f. 1v-7r), the Navārṇavamantra and its Nyāsa (f. 7v-10v), and Saptaśatikanyānyāsavidhi (f. 10v-15r); also an unidentified section (f. 15r-18v) containing a selection of various topics, such as the Devī and Rātri sūktas, Navārṇavamantra, and the Bhagavatīstavarāja; a variety of Hindu deities are evoked throughout, especially goddesses, as well as a number of Vedic gods such as Agni, Vāyu, and Sūrya; some textual parallels can be made with Item 1434 and Item 1380.|Copied in Mathurā on the banks of the Yamunā River near the Rām Ghāṭ (f. 18r).|Scribe is Putranihāla Maṇī, or Nihāla Maṇī as text was augmented (f. 18r), who appears to have also been the scribe of UPenn Ms. Coll. 390, Item 463.|Written 7 lines per leaf.|Good condition. Mistakes covered over with yellow or gray. Orange powder rubbed in to highlight some invocations and sectional headings. Marginal corrections and lengthy additions.|Incipit: om̐ śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ ācamya prāṇān āyamya adyetyādi mama pūjanajapādau saphalatvasidhyarthe ādau bhūtaśuddhiprāṇapratiṣṭhāṁ ca kariṣye om̐ ādhāraśaktikamalāsanāya namaḥ ity āsanaṁ saṁpūjya tatra prāṅmukha udaṅmukho vā siddhāsane samupaviśya tatra āsana prakārayet (f. 1v).|Colophon of first section: iti bhūtaśuddhiprāṇapratiṣṭhā saṁpūrṇaṁ samāptaḥ (f. 7r).|Explicit: maṁtrahīnaṁ kriyāhīnaṁ bhaktihīnaṁ maheśvari ya stutāsi mayā devi tasmā tvaṁ varadā bhava (f. 17v-18r).|Colophon (final): likhitaṁ mathurāyāṁ rāmaghāṭasyopariyamunā putr[eṇa]nihālamaṇī śubhaṁ patra aṣṭādaśaṁ 18 (f. 18r).|May have been housed at an earlier time with Item 461, Item 463, and Item 464.|Non-Latin script record.

note: Manuscript is likely the first 18 folios of Ms. Coll. 390, Item 1186, which begins on f. 19. While this manuscript has a smaller height than Item 1186, there are clear signs of manuscript repair and alteration and it may well have been cut at some point. The scribal hand looks to be the same and there are similar corrective marks in red throughout. The width of the manuscript, moreover, is the same as the beginning folios of 1186, which has folios of several different widths throughout. The line count of both manuscripts is 9-11 lines per leaf side. The paper quality is also the same or similar. These two manuscripts should likely be read together.|Title from marginal abbreviation (f. 2v).|Written in 9-11 lines per leaf.|18 leaves foliated 1-18, upper left and lower right verso.|Incipit: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ // oṃ namo parabrahmaṇe namaḥ // yasmaniḥ śvasitaṃvedāyovedebhyo khilajagat // (f. 1r).|Scribe is Brahmānandābhidheyabhikṣu as named on Ms. Coll. 390, Item 1186 (f. 100v), which is likely originally part of this manuscript.|Mistakes covered over in yellow or blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout; vertical margins marked with double red line.

physical_description: Extent: 136, 4 leaves : paper, illustrations ; 300 x 180 (210 x 110) mm bound to 308 x 190 mm
note: Title from incipit (f. 1r).|Foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.|Layout: 15 long lines, border-ruled.|Script: Written in nastaʻliq in black ink; pointed.|Decoration: Textblock is border-ruled in green, beige, red, and blue with the page-opening ruled in blue. Rubrications in red. The first opening has two polychrome and gold miniatures and the text in cloudbands (f. 1v-2r). Nine other miniatures in bright, primary colors also appear (f. 4v, 31r, 34v, 42v, 48v, 63v, 77v, 96v, 126r).|Binding: Papier-mâché́ covers painted and lacquered with a flowering tree within a polylobed arch on exteriors and doublures. Exterior cover trees are on a green background with yellow arch and orange frame; doublure trees are on an orange background with yellow arch and green frame. A piece of bright blue textile embroidered with white thread covers the spine.|Origin: The copy is not dated, but likely produced in the first half of the 19th century, in India.|Formerly owned by Françoise and Claude Bourelier.|Sold by Sam Fogg Rare Books & Manuscripts (London), 2016.

note: Title from incipit (f. 1r).|Written in 10 lines per leaf.|2 leaves foliated 1-2, upper left and lower right verso.|Incipit: athapaṃcīkaraṇyalikhyate // (f. 1r).|Dated saṃvat 1875 (1818) (f. 2v).|Mistakes blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; vertical margins marked with double red line.

Includes commentary Bhāgavatabhāvārthadīpikā by Śrīdharasvāmin.|Pagination: folios 1-71a, 71b-84, 1-10.|Folios 1-74. Mistakes covered over with yellow or blanked out with black. Orange powder rubbed in over colophons, some introductions of speakers, and some words. A few marginal corrections by the scribe. Folios 5 verso and 71b recto have been left blank. Folios 75-84, 1-10: Double daṇḍas, one colophon and every other syllable of another colophon in red on folios 75 recto and 10 recto. The double daṇḍas and syllables to be written in red have been omitted from the other folios of this part of the manuscript. The text continues into the right margin on many of the folios. Poleman notes that the text is continuous and that folio 71b verso contains part of the text to be inserted on folio 70a recto.|Written in 12-19 lines per leaf.|Non-Latin script record.

note: Medieval retelling of the epic story of the Rāmāyaṇa, wherein the hero Rāma is identified with the universal spirit (adhyātma) and is nonviolent; narrative takes the form of a dialogue between the Hindu deity Śiva (as Maheśa) and his consort the goddess Pārvatī (as Umā); traditionally ascribed to the legendary author Vyāsa. This fifth section (kāṇḍa) of the Adhyātmarāmāyaṇa contains the narrative about the monkey deity Hanuman's exploration of the island of Laṅkā; he visits the princess Sītā, who is held captive by the demons who live on the island, and sets fire to their main city. Text is incomplete containing only the first six verses of the final, fifth chapter of the work.|Title from title page (f. 1r).|Written in 9 lines per leaf.|22 leaves foliated 1-22, upper left and lower right verso.|Colophon (chapter 4): iti śrīmadadhyā[t]marāmāyaṇe umāmaheśvarasaṃvāde suṃdarakāṃḍe caturthaḥ sargaḥ // 4 // (f. 21v-22r).|Mistakes blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins.|Written on European stock of paper with discernible watermark, possibly of a crown and various letters and/or numbers that are not quite legible.|Non-Latin script record.

note: F. 1r begins with Nivṛttinyāsa (title from ff. 1r and 2r), after which follows Navārṇamantra (title from f. 2r) and its Nyāsa, then Ekādaśanyāsa (title from f. 6r) and a related Dhyāna. The latter half of the manuscript contains a version of Bhūtaśuddhiprāṇapratiṣṭhā (cf. UPenn Ms. Coll. 390, Item 1434 and Item 1380, etc.). Title Bhūtaśuddhyādi from colophon.|Written 7-8 lines per leaf.|Two folios (6a and 6b) numbered as f. 6.|Good condition. Mistakes covered over with yellow or blotched out with black. note: Title from colophon (f. 11v) and cover page (f. 1r). F. 1v gives alternate title Śarabhakavacastotramantra. Cover page reads: athaśarabhakavacaprārambhaḥ. śrī.|Copied by Ābā Śarmaṇ.|Written 9-10 lines per leaf.|Two leaves are given the page number 10.|Good condition.|Begins: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ. atha śarabhakavacastotramantraprārambhaḥ. om̐ asya śrīśarabha[-----]pakṣirājakavacastotramantrasya. Kālāgnirudraṛṣaye namaḥ śirasi. atijagatī chandase namaḥ mukhe. śrīśarabheśvaro devatāyai namaḥ hṛdaye. om̐ bījāya namaḥ guhye.|Ends (f. 11r): yat kṛtyaṁ taṁ na kṛtaṁ yad akṛtyaṁ kṛtyavat tad ācaritaṁ. ubhayor prāyaścittaṁ śiva tava nāmākṣaradvayo caritaṁ.|Colophon: iti śrīmadākāśabhairavakalpe pratyakṣasiddhiprade umāmaheśvarasaṁvāde śarabhakavacaṁ nāmaikacatvāriṁśodhyāyaḥ. śake 1700 vilaṁbī nāma saṁvatsare māghe māsi śuklapakṣe ṣaṣṭyāyāṁ tithau mandavāsaraḥ taddine idaṁ pustakaṁ samāptaṁ. limayopanāmak ābāśarmaṇena likhitaṁ.

subject_as_recorded: Tantrism|Tantrism|Hindu hymns, Sanskrit|Hindu hymns, Sanskrit|Śarabha (Hindu deity)|Hinduism--Rituals--Texts|Hinduism--Rituals
note: Written 12-13 lines per leaf.|Poor condition. Paper is browned and fraying. Orange powder rubbed over section headings and invocations. Mistakes crossed through or blotched out with black. Marginal corrections. Ff. 1-3 torn through middle and repaired. F. 14 torn through middle and repaired, with a hole affecting 4 lines of text. Marginal corrections.|Begins (f. 1v): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ. śrīḥ om̐ namaḥ pakṣirājāya niśitakuliśavaradaṁ drȧnaravāya anekakoṭibrahmakapālamālālaṁkṛtāya sakalakrūramahānāmabhūṣaṇāya [...].|"Prayoga" begins (f. 2r): atha prayogaḥ. om̐ aiṁ krīṁ śriṁ namo bhagavate śrīśivāya [ya]mayuratḥ jvala 2 prajvala 2 asādhyaṁ sādhaya 2 rakṣa 2 sarva[-]uṣṭebhyo [hu?]ṁ phaṭ svāhā.|"Prayoga" ends (f. 3v): spṛśan yasya japaṁ kṛtvā pratisthānaṁ samāhitaḥ prārthayed akhilaṁ sveṣṭaṁ hradisthaṁ sāluveśvaraṁ (3). śrīśiva.|Śarabhakavaca begins (f. 4r): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ. athāpi śṛṇu deveśi sarvalakṣaṇam adbhutaṁ śārabhaṁ kavacaṁ nāma caturvargaphalapradaṁ (verse 1). śarabhaḥ pakṣirājasya kavacasya sadāśivaḥ ṛṣiṣ́chandosya bṛhatī procyate śarabheśvaraḥ (verse 2).|Śarabhakavaca ends (f. 8r): ubhayoḥ prāyaścittaṁ śiva tava nāmākṣaradvayaṁ (verse 111).|Colophon f. 8r: iti śrīmatākāśabhairavatantre umāmaheśvarasaṁvāde śarabhakavacaṁ nāmaikādaśaḥ paṭalaḥ.|Śarabhasahasranāmastotra begins (f. 8r): atha stotraṁ. bhairava uvāca. śṛṇu devi mahāguhyaṁ paramaṁ puṇyavar[--]ūnaṁ. śarabheśāṣṭakaṁ mantraṁ vakṣyāmi tava tattvataḥ (verse 1).|Śarabhasahasranāmastotra ends (f. 14v): prayataḥ prātaḥ brahmacā[rya----a?]teṁdriyaḥ. abhinnayogo varṣaṁ tu aśvamedhaphalaṁ labhet.|Colophon f. 14v: ityākāśabhairavatantre kalpe hariharabrahmaviraci[taṁ śabha]rasahasranāmastotraṁ samp[ū]rṇā. śrīvaijanāthāya namaḥ.

[1v]): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḣ. śrīrādhākṛṣṇāya namaḥ. atha gāyatrīkavacaprārambhaḥ. om̐ asya śrīgāyatrīkavacasya. brahmaviṣṇumaheśvaraṛṣibhyo namaḥ. śirasi. ṛgyajusāmātharvānichandosyai namaḥ mukhe. parabrahmavidyāgāyatrīdevatāyāi namaḥ hṛda [-|Ends (f. [3r]): iti śrī agastisaṁhitāyāṁ gāyatrīkavacaṁ samāptaṁ. śake 1716 bhāvanā 0 mārgaśīrṣaśuddha 7 maumavāsare taddīnam idaṁ pustakaṁ samāptaṁ.

Mistakes are blacked out or covered in yellow.|Encased within two wooden covers.|Incipit: agnirvaidevānāmavamo viṣṇuḥ paramastadaṃtareṇa sarvā anyā devatāḥ (Part 1, f. 1v).|Pañcikā 1 colophon: saṃvat 1848. samayanāmamargaśirṣaśukla 15 paurṇamāsyāṃ sanivāsare likhitaṃ / triguṇāyitākhyena rāmaprasāda brāḥmaṇena vārāṇaśyām gaṇeśasya nikaṭe // (Part 1, f. 34r)|Pañcikā 2 colophon: saṃvat 1848 samaiyanāmapauṣaśukla 11 gurau tad dine likhitarāmapraśādabrāḥmaṇena śubham // (Part 2, f. 43r).|Pañcikā 3 colophon: saṃvat 1848 samayaphālgunaśukla 6 bhaume likhitaṃ idaṃ triguṇāyitety upanāmakarāmapraśādena // (Part 3, f. 44r).|Pañcikā 4 colophon: iti caturthapañcikāyāṃ pañcamodhyāyaḥ / iti caturthapaṃcikāsamāptāḥ // (Part 4, f. 34r).|Pañcikā 5 colophon: iti pañcamapañcikāyām pañcamodhyāyaḥ / saṃvat 1849 miticitrakṛṣṇa 10 śubhaṃ bhūyāstāṃ lekhapāṭhakayoḥ śrī rastu // (Part 5, f. 42v).|Pañcika 6 colophon: saṃvat 1849 caitraśukla 7 guruvāsare śubham // śubhaṃ bhavatu // likhite rāmapraśādabrāhmaṇena triguṇāyita ity upanāmakena śrīrastu śubhaṃ // (Part 6, f. 37r).|Pañcikā 7 colophon: saṃvat 1849 samayānāmacaitraśukla 15 // śubhaṃbhūyāstāṃ ubhayoḥ // śrīḥ // (Part 7, f. 33r).|Pañcikā 8 colophon: iti aṣṭama pañcikā samāptah śubham bhavatu // cha // śrīḥ // śrīrāmacaṃdrāyanamaḥ // śrīviśveśvarāyanamaḥ // śrīvighnavināyako vijayate tarām saṃva 1849 samayanāmavaiśākhakṛṣṇa 5 bhaumavāsare saṃpūrṇaṃ śubhaṃ likhitaṃ rāmaprasādatriguṇāyita iti upanāmaka brāhmaẹna śubham bhūyāstām lekhakapāṭhakayoḥ // cha // śrīviśveśvārpaṇāmastu // śrīyainamaḥ // cha // śrīḥ // (Part 8, f. 30r).|Dated between saṃvat 1848 samaiyanāma puṣaśukla 11 (Sunday, January 16, 1792) (Part 2, f. 43r) and saṃvat 1849 iti citra kṛṣṇa 10 (Friday, May 11, 1792) (Part 8, f. 30r).|Scribe is Rāmapraśāda Triguṇāyita (Part 1, f. 34r; Part 3, f. 44r; Part 8, f. 30r) in Vārāṇasī near the Gaṇeśa (Dhundiraj Temple).

note: Title from end title page (f. 12v).|Written in 7-8 lines per leaf.|12 leaves foliated 1-12, upper left and lower right verso.|Dated incoherently. The number 1783 is written (f. 12r) without either saṃvat or śaka. Saṃvat would render the date 1726 A.D. whereas śaka would render it 1861. The date of 1726 A.D. would be most likely for this manuscript; however, there is also a reference to the month Śrīmukha Saṃvatsara year, which could correspond to 1753, 1813, or 1873 A.D., none of which corresponds to the hypothetical saṃvat or śaka date.|Mistakes covered over in white or blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout; vertical margins marked with double black line.

note: A tied book containing four texts: Bhagavatīpadmapuṣpāñjali by Rāmakṛṣṇa (pp. 1-12), Śivastotra (pp. 14-15), Somavāravratapūjāvidhi (pp. 19-25), and Achidravrata (pp. 27-28).|Title Bhagavatīpadmapuṣpāñjali from colophon p. 12. Title Śivastotra supplied by ms. label and used by Poleman. Title Somavāravratapūjāvidhi from colophon p. 25. Title Achidravrata supplied by cataloger.|Written 8-10 lines per leaf on country paper.|Fair condition. Orange powder rubbed in over invocations, colophons, numbers, and section headings. Mistakes written over or indicated by short diagonal or vertical strokes.|Cover has drawing in black of a 10-armed goddess, presumably Durgā, with her mount. Picture partially obscured by reddish-brown splotches.|Bhagavatīpadmapuṣpāñjali begins (p. 1): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ om̐ namaḥ caṇḍikāyai namaḥ śambho namaḥ om̐ bhagavatībhagavatpadapaṅkajaṁ bhramarabhūtasurāsurasevitaṁ* sujanamānasahaṁsapariskṛtaṁ kamalayāmalayānibhṛtaṁ bhaje (verse 1).|Colophon to Bhagavatīpadmapuṣpāñjali (p. 12): iti śrīrāma[kṛ]ṣṇaviracitaṁ bhagavatīpadmapuṣpāñjaliḥ sampūrṇaṁ.|Śivastotra begins (p. 14): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ om̐ namaḥ jayadeva jayādeva jayājeya jayaśaṅkaraśāśvata jayasarvasurādhyakṣa jayasarvasurārcitta (verse 1).|Colophon to Śivastotra (p. 16): iti mama vadatodināniyātu* smara hara kiṁ vahajalpakalpanābhiḥ [?] ( verse 15).|A new, unnamed text begins on f. 16, which is left off after two lines (pp. 17-18 blank).|Somavāravratapūjāvidhi begins (pp. 19-25): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ atha somavāravratapūjāvidhiḥ. tatra kartā [o?]cirācat̄taḥ bhuktāmbaradharaḥ kṛtyakriyaḥ pradoṣasamaye [u?]da[ṅktu?]khopaveśyācamya|Colophon to Somavāravratapūjāvidhi (p. 25): iti somavāravratapūjāvidhiḥ samāptāḥ śubhm.|Achidravrata begins (p. 27): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ atha a[ch]idraḥ vratānāṁ vratarājendravratānāṁ vratam uttamaṁ vratachidraṁ tapachidraṁ yachidraṁ yajñakarmaṇi (verse 1).|Achidravrata ends (p. 28): śrīviṣọprasādāt vrāhmaṇavacanāt sarvaṁ paripūrṇam astu paripūrṇatāstu. śubhm.

note: Title for manuscript from title abbreviations in margins for first work (f. 1-9); title of second work, Śvetāśvataropaniṣad, from marginal abbreviations (f. 10-22).|Written in 8-10 lines per leaf.|22 leaves foliated 1-22, upper left and lower right verso.|Mistakes covered over in yellow or blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout; metrical accents in red; vertical margins marked with double red line.

Written 7 lines per leaf. Encased with two wooden covers, accented in red, part of final colophon in red. Some corrections in aṣṭaka 7 in yellow. Aṣṭaka 8 is in a different hand than aṣṭakas 1-7.|Aṣṭaka 1 Colophon: Samvat 1759, śāke 1624. Nandanābde. Phālguna śuddha 6 ṣaṣṭī gurau bharaṅyām aindrayoge ātaḥ samaye likhitam idam gaṅapatyaḥ upanāmaka dyotiḥ [vivvad] durgābhatena svārtham paramārtham ca Bāndhava deśe riām grāme sampādita iyam samrāma hi tā prathama aṣṭakasya pustakam. śubham bhūyāt. Śri Veda Vyāsa ārdhana śri kṛṣnārdhanam astu. Samvat 1762 Samaye Kārtika []1611 kastuyepi nāmakavi nāyakena savritam.|Aṣṭaka 2 Colophon: iti dvitiya aṣṭake aṣṭam adhyāyaḥ. Śri Krsnaārpanamastu. Śubha samvat 1760, śake 1624 gurumāne vijayābde caitra śuddha saptamyām manda vāsare mṛga nakśatre sāmyādne likhitam idam ganapatya upanāmaka dyotiḥ [vivvad] durgābhatena svārtham paramartham ca. Bandhavadeśe rivām grāme godhūma kśetramadhye sampādita iyam samhitā dvitīya aṣṭakasya pustakam. śubham bhūyāt. Samvat 1762 samaye kārtika [] 7 kasturi upanāma kavi nāyakena svaritam.|Aṣṭaka 3 ends without colophon.|Aṣṭaka 4 Colophon: Samvat 1760 śāke 1624 gurumane vijayābde adhīka dvitiya śravaṇa kṛṣnāmāvāsyarvau bāndhava deśe rivām grāme likhitam idam gaṇapati upanāmaka dyoti [vivvad] durgābhatena samhitā caturtha aṣṭakasya pustakam svārtham paramārtham ca. śubhamastu. śri kṛṣnārpaṇamastu. Samvat 1762 samaye pauṣava 61 kasturya upanāma kavināyakena svaritam.|Aṣṭaka 5 Colophon: Samvat 1731 śāke śalivāhanasya 1626 jayanāma samvatsare udagayaneva samtatau vaiśākhe māsika kṛṣna caturdaśyam mṛgavāsare bāndhava deśe rivām grāme likhitam idam samhita paṅcama aṣṭaka pustakam cainitya upanāmakavi ....bhaṭṭam svārtham paramārtham ca. śrikṛṣnārpanamastu. śri veda vyāsārpanamastu. samvat 1762 samaye pauṣau 68 kasturī vināyakena svaritam. śri vedapuruṣārpanamastu.|Aṣṭaka 6 colophon: Samvat 1761 śake 1626 jayanāma samvatsare udagayane griṣmaḥ trau jyeṣṭamāse kṛṣne pakśe saptamīm dhaniṡthaḥ kśaidrayoga ekarkalagne likhitam idam bandhava deśe rivām grāme ṣaṣṭaka samhitā pustakam gnapati upanāmaka durgābhatena svārtham paramārtham ca. śubhamastu. samvat 1762 samaye caitra vahi 11 vudha kasturi upanāmakavi nāyakena . svaritam.|Aṣṭaka 7 colophon: samvat 1762 śāke 1626 vijaya abde māgha kṛṣna 6 śukrehastaḥ akśe sukarmayogena tayugma lagne likhitam idam bāndhava deśe rivām grāme saptama aṣṭaka samhitā pustakam cainitya upanāmakavi.svārtham paramārtham ca. śubhamastu. śri vijayādurgāprasanna. śri kṛṣnārpanam.|Aṣṭaka 8 colophon: samvat 1710 varṣe phālguṇavadit bhomavāsare likhitam idam pustakam....iti̲ aṣṭakaḥ samāptaḥ. itī śākala samhitāsamāptaḥ. śubhamastu.

subject_as_recorded: Pali language--Grammar|Theravāda Buddhism--Doctrines
physical_description: Extent: 1 item (579 leaves) : palm leaf ; 5 x 55 cm
note: Written in 5 lines per leaf.|Fascicles 1-15 have main text in Pali, written in Khom script, and paratexts on the cover leaves in Thai; facscicles 16-17 have main text in Pali and titles on cover leaves in Thai, all written in Khom script.|Paginated with the traditional combinations of consonants and vowel diacritics in alphabetic order, verso left margin.|Leaves of palm leaf with two central holes approximately 19 cm apart, cord through one set of holes, and gilt edges (chabap thong thuep).|Simple wooden covers, with gilt on the sides, probably from the process of gilding the text block.|A detailed description of this manuscript by Dr. Peera Panarut is on file at the library.|Sponsored by Chao Khun Wang Luang (Lady Nun Bunnag, 1777-1836) in Bangkok in 1834 (colophon in Thai script on the cover leaf of each fascicle; Peera Panarut).

Śake 1702 śārvari nāma samvatsare śrāvaṇa śuddha tritiyā gurūvāsare taddine Govinda Bhaṭṭāsajatukam Bhaṭṭena likhitam svārtham paramārtham ca. lekhaka pāṭhakayoh śubhambhavatu. bhagna pṛṣṭikati grīvah sthabdha dṛṣṭih dhomukhah. kaṣṭena likhitam grantham yatnena paripālayetū. adṛṣṭa doṣānmati viśrmādvāyat kimcidanam likhitam mayātra. tat sarvamāryauh pariśodhanīyam kopam na kuryuh khalu lekhasya.

note: Title from f. 9v.|Title and attribution according to New Catalogus Catalogorum: "Caṇḍī(stotra)prayoga(vidhi) by Nāgeśa Bhaṭṭa (or Nāgojī Bhaṭṭa); from his C. on Caṇḍīstotra or Devīmāhātmya."|Listed by Poleman as Caṇḍīprayoga.|Written 11-19 lines per leaf in two or more hands.|Good condition.|Mistakes crossed out or blocked out in black.|Begins: atha vārāhītantre. caṇḍīpāṭhaphalaṃ dīvī śṛṇu gadato mama. ekāvattyādipāṭhānāṁ pratyahaṁ paṭhatāṁ nṛṇāṁ. saṁkalpyapūrvaṁ saṁpūjyanyasyāṅgeṣu manūn sakṛt.|Ends: uttaracaritrasya ṛ[?] śiva ṛṣiḥ. mahāsarasvatī devatā. chandonuṣṭup jagaty aubhīmā śakti bhramarī bījaṁ. sūryas tatvaṁ. ucāṭanādau viṣeṣatto viniyoga iti. tat tu kātyāyanītantroktaṁ mantravibhāgene[?] virodhāt nimūla iti dhyoyaṁ[?].|Colophon: iti śrīmadupādhāyopanāmakaśivabhaṭṭasu[--]ttasatīgarbhajanāgojībhaṭṭakṛte mā[r]kaṇḍirāyapurāṇāntargatasaptaśatyākhyācaṇḍīstotraprayogavidhiḥ samāptaḥ.

Title from colophon, which is incomplete, perhaps indicating that the manuscript is itself incomplete. Title abbreviations in upper left of ff. 1-3 read "Dī. Na.," suggesting (based upon the subject matter) a title beginning "Dīkṣā-Na..." Title abbreviations on ff. 4-8 read "Maṁ," suggesting a title beginning "Mantra..."|Written 9-10 lines per leaf.|Fair condition. All leaves colored yellow. Paper brown and fragile, beginning to deteriorate on edges. Text written in brown ink. Orange powder rubbed in to highlight sectional divisions, invocations, and some other words and syllables. Mistakes covered over with white, crossed through with brown, or blotched out with black or brown. Lengthy additions and commentary in margins of most folios, in brown and black ink.|Folio 1r has a table and some text. Folio 2r has two small Yantras, six-pointed stars in circles enclosed by squares, and another smaller six-pointed star.|Begins (f. 1v): śrīr jayati. atha gurulakṣaṇam. śānto dāntaḥ kulīnaś ca vinītaḥ śuddhaveṣavān. śuddhācāraḥ supratiṣṭhaḥ śucir dakṣaḥ subuddhimān. 1. āśramī dhyānaniṣṭhaś ca maṁtrataṁtraśāradaḥ. nigrahānugrahe śakto gurur ity abhidhīyate 2|Text ends (f. 10v): om̐ namo nīlakaṇṭhāya* brahmā ṛṣir gāyatrī chandaḥ nīlakaṇṭho devatā puruṣārthacatuṣṭayaprāptaye jape viniyogaḥ nyāsādipūrvavat 10|Colophon (f. 10v): iti śrīmaṁtramaṁjūṣāyāṁ gaṇe

note: Title from cover page (f. 1r) and f. 15v. Cover page reads: atha śarabhasahasranāmaprārambhaḥ. F. 15v reads: iti śarabhasahasranāmasampūrṇaṁ. Title from colophon is Śarabheśvarasahasranāman. F. 15v reads: iti śarabhasahasranāmasampūrṇaṁ.|Title of this text, according to New Cat. Cat., is Śarabha(īśvara)sahasranāma(-stava, stotra).|Copied by Dhoṇḍabhaṭṭa.|Written 9 lines per leaf.|Good condition. Mistakes marked over in black.|Begins: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ śrīsarasvatyai namaḥ śrīgurubyāṁ namaḥ hariḥ om̐ śrī devyuvāca devadevamahādeva bhaktānugrahakārakaḥ durllabhā śārabhī vidyā guhyād guhyatarāparā (verse 1). guṭikā pādukā siddhistathā siddhiśca khecarī śāpānugrahasāmrthyā parakāyapraveśane (verse 2).|Stotra begins f. 3r: atha sahasranāmaprārambhaḥ om̐ śrīṁ śrīṁ siddhīśvaraḥ sākṣāt kheṁ kheṁ garvāpahārakaḥ hrīṁ hrīṁ spreṁ sphreṁ [hlauṁ hlauṁ?] 'lū 'lūṁ pakṣirājaḥ pratāpavān (verse 1).|Ends: svamātṛyonivad goyyaṁ vidyaiṣetyāgamājaguḥ paṭhanīyam idaṁ nityaṁ ātmanā śreyam ichatā na muñcati gṛhaṁ tas[m]āllakṣmī vāṇī sadaiva hi (verse 128).|Colophon: iti śrīākāśabhairavakalpe umāmaheśvarasaṁvāde śarabheśvarasahasranāmasampūrṇaṁ. om̐ śrīmadumāśaṅkarābhyāṁ namaḥ. saṁvat 1881 śake 1746 varṣe parāj̃ape upanāmakadhoṇḍabhaṭṭena likhitaṁ śivaṁ. śloka 151.

note: Title from colophon (f. 13r); alternate title Tithinirṇaya from title page (f. 1r).|Written in 8-10 lines per leaf.|14 leaves foliated 1-13, [i], upper left and lower right verso.|Colophon: iti tithinirṇayasiṃdhuḥ samāptim agamat // (f. 13r).|Scribe is Govinda, son of Śrīdhara (f. 13r).|Dated saṃvat 1661 (1604) (f. 13r).|Mistakes covered over in yellow or blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout; vertical margins marked with double red line.|Formerly owned by Godajośī Dhātoṇḍa (f. 13r). The name Dhātoṇḍa may suggest that the manuscript comes from a village in the Punjab region of India with that name or that the former owner originally comes from the district. There is also a reference to Kāśī (Varāṇasī) in the post-colophon text (f. 13r), possibly suggesting that the owner, originally from the Punjab, had settled in Varāṇasī when the manuscript was written.

subject_as_recorded: Hinduism--Early works to 1800
physical_description: Extent: 124 leaves : paper, illustrations ; 305 x 155 (242 x 115) mm bound to 315 x 175 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloguer.|Foliation: Inconsistent marking of each book number in Hindu-Arabic numerals in upper left recto. Modern foliation in pencil added, upper left recto; catchwords, lower left verso. Leaves are adhered together in groups in several places, foliation is continuous, but not every folio may be viewed in its entirety. References in the record are to the modern foliation.|Layout: 21 long lines, border-ruled.|Script: Written in nastaʻliq in black ink; pointed.|Decoration: Rubrications in red, including chapter summaries and overlining; textblock border-ruled in blue, orange, black, gold; page-opening rule in blue; 7 half-page polychrome painted illustrations begin each chapter (f. 1v, 41v, 45v, 144v, 162v, 173v, 177v).|Binding: Bound in blue and white paper over pasteboard with brown leather spine and cornerpieces.|Origin: Likely copied in South Asia in the mid- to late-18th century.|Sold at auction at PBA Galleries (San Francisco) 15 June 2017, lot 132.

note: Title from marginal abbreviations.|Written in 6-7 lines per leaf.|305 leaves foliated (Part 1) 1-33, (Part 2) 1-42, (Part 3) 1-44, (Part 4) 1-35, (Part 5) 1-46, (Part 6) 1-39, (Part 7) 1-34, (Part 8) 1-32, upper left and lower right verso.|Dated saṃvat 1819-20 and śaka 1684-85 (1762-1763; Part 2, f. 42r and Part 8, f. 32r).|Mistakes covered over in yellow or blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout; vertical margins marked with triple red line; borders of folios treated with yellow turmeric powder to protect the manuscript from insect damage.|Scribe is possibly Gālambhaṭṭa Kāle as noted at the end of one section of the text (Part 6, f. 39); however, Kāle is primarily named throughout as a former owner, so this single instance may simply be a scribal error using the instrumental instead of genitive case, and the word likhitaṃ (was written/scribed) typically accompanying the instrumental case is lacking. However the other named owner of Part 3, Janārdana Kāle, is the scribe of another manuscript of the Aitareyabrāhmaṇa in the collection (University of Pennsylvania, Ms. Coll. 390, Item 85). This may indicate a family of owners/scribes of this particular group of texts.|Formerly owned by Gālambhaṭṭa Kāle, son of Triṃbakabhaṭṭa and the grandson of Sadāśivabhaṭṭa Kāle (Part 4, f. 35r). Also formerly owned by Janārdana Kāle (Part 3, f. 44r).

physical_description: Extent: 1 paper, color illustrations ; 11 x 28 cm
note: Title supplied by cataloger.|Written in 9-11 lines per leaf.|49 leaves foliated 1-49, lower right verso.|Mistakes blacked or crossed out; some corrections and additions in margins; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout.|Single wooden cover with lacquer coating bearing a painting of the Hindu deity Gaṇeśa flanked on the left and right by two female attendants in the act of worshiping the god. Red wash serves as the background with a green floral border. Paper is European with several different watermarks, some bearing a crest, possibly representing a stylized letter "B" resting on a pedestal and above which is a crown; another bears the date of 1839, establishing the terminus post quem of the manuscript.|Non-Latin script record.

note: This manuscript contains several texts composed by Svāmin Rāmabrahmānanda Sarasvatī, the pupil of Svayaṁprakāśānanda Sarasvatī (see colophon, f. 7r): Rāmānandalaharī (ff. 1r-7r, in nine sections [taraṅga]), Samodayastotra (ff. 7r-7v), Rāmastavarāja (ff. 8r-8v), Rāmāparādhastotra (ff. 9r-9v), and Vijñaptistotra (ff. 9v-10r).|Title Rāmānandalaharī from sectional colophons and final colophons, ff. 1-7r; other texts' titles from their respective final colophons.|Written 18-20 lines per leaf.|Good condition. Mistakes crossed through or blotched out with black, or indicated with vertical stroke over syllable in question. Marginal corrections.|Rāmānandalaharī begins, f. 1r: śrīrāmo jayati śubhārthī yo rāma praṇamati padābje tava janas tad aṁgulyāgrotthāmalanakharucāṁ paṁktir aruṇā lalāṭe tasyādau sumaṇiśubhike[-]ollasati yā nibaddhā tatsidhyai mama diśatu seṣṭārtham akhilam 1|Colophon, f. 7r: iti matparamahaṁsaparivrājakācāryavaryaśrīmatsvayaṁprakāśānaṁdapūjyapādaśiṣyaśrīmadrāmabrahmānaṁdasarasvatisvāmiviracitāyāṁ śrīrāmānaṁdalaharyāṁ navamas taraṁgaḥ 1 samāpteyaṁ rāmānandalaharī śrīrāmacaṁdrārpaṇam astu|Samodayastotra begins, f. 7r: [ā]dāv aṁte yan na hi tat syān na kadācin niścityaiva tādṛśadehādyabhimānaṁ[--]mu[ktā?]bādhyaṁ kālaviśeṣair jana te taṁ rāmaṁ svāṁte bhāvaya santaṁ bhagavantam 1|Colophon, f. 7v: iti śrīmatparamahaṁsaparivrājakācāryavaryaśrīmatsvayaṁprakāśānaṁdapūjyapādaśiṣyaśrīmadrāmabrahmānaṁdasarasvatisvāmiviracitaṁ śamodayaṁ stotraṁ sampūrṇam śrīrāma|Rāmastavarāja begins, f. 8r: śrīrāmo jayati śāmāya rāmāya raviprabhāya rākeṁduvaktrāya ramādhavāya rājādhirājāya ragha[tra?]māya ravīṁdranetrāya namaḥ parasmai 1|Colophon, f. 8v: iti śrīmadrāmabrahmānaṁdasarasvatisvāmiviracitaṁ rāmastavarājaṁ saṁpūrṇam|Rāmāparādhastotra begins, f. 9r: śrīrāmo jayati nāhaṁ śāstram anaṁtam īśa paṭhitum śaktaś ca vedyaṁ bahu svalpaṁ cāyur anantavighnanivahīs[?] tatrāpi mauḍhyaṁ bahu yat kiṁcit paṭhitaṁ tu rāghava guror no sevayācāryatām evechāmi na śiṣyatām kvacit api vrātyaṁ tataḥ pāhi mām 1|Colophon, f. 9v: iti srīmadrāmabrahmānaṁdasarasvatīsvāmiviracitaṁ śrīrāmāparādhastotra saṁpūrṇaṁ|Vijñaptistotra begins, f. 9v: saulabhyaṁ cayaratnam īśa sahaja tvayy eva tanmūlakaṣṭa kin no rāma samastasadguṇacayā satyaiva te kāraṇe kāryaṁ kin na tatra kān api guṇān uccāryamukto khilaḥ sindhor nīram aśeṣataḥ pibati kiṁ tṛptyai pipāsurnarāḥ 1|Colophon, f. 10r: iti śrīmadrāmabrahmānaṁdasarasvativiracitaṁ vijñaptistotraṁ sapūrṇam śrīrāmārpaṇam

note: Tattvārthacintāmaṇi of Bālakṛṣṇa Vedavṛkṣa, with the commentary Maṇiprakāśa or Tattvārthacintāmaṇivṛttavṛttimaṇiprakāśa. Titles from f. 1v, 7r; author listed f. 7r (colophon to text).|The author, Bālakṛṣṇa Vedavṛkṣa, lived 1796-1830 (Pingree).|Text written 1-5 lines per leaf; commentary written 6-16 lines per leaf.|Text begins: śrīgaṇeśo jayati śrīmaddevagurūn praṇamya bahuśogranthān vidhāyādhunā nā[?] keralipañcapakṣiviṣayān vijñāya tatvārthadān d[ai]vajñatvakara[---]ikālakalanaṁ tatvārthacintāmaṇiṁ kurvve[?] kāmaduhaśca pañcakhacarair vvarṇasvarād īśvaraiḥ (verse 1).|Commentary begins: ṣayoyeṣu tān vijñāya kim bhūvān tatvārthadān vāstavaprayojanabodhakān atra bahutvena tatsamudāyasya tatvārthadātṛtvam bodhitaṁ tenāsya tvekasyaiveti dhunvate[?] kim bhutaṁ tatvārthacintāmaṇiṁ daivatvakaraṁ daivam devacaritaṁ bhāgyaṁ bā jānātīti.|Colophon of text (f. 7r): iti śrīmatpārvatavedavṛkṣavālakṛṣṇaviracitaḥ keralapañcapakṣisvaravicār[e] tatvārthacintāmaṇināmāgranthaḥ samāptaḥ.|Colophon of commentary: iti śrīmadvedavṛkṣavālakṛṣṇaviracitaḥ svakṛtatatvārthacintāmaṇivṛttavṛttimaṇiprakāśaḥ sampūrṇaḥ.

note: Title supplied by cataloger. The first heading in the text reads "Ṛgvedināṁ Madhyāhnasandhyāprayoga." Cataloged in Poleman's Census by the phrase "iti Ṛgvedinām Āhnikaprayogaḥ," which doesn't seem to occur in the ms. Cataloged as "Āhnikaprayoga for Ṛgvedins" in New Catalogus Catalogorum. Title abbreviation on right margin of recto folios: śrād[dha?].|Written 2-4 lines per leaf on palm leaves.|Palm leaves strung together with a cord through center hole, with wooden covers. Ink fading on some leaves. Fading text written over in black ink on many folios, and in purple ink on some others. Marginal additions.|Begins, f. 2v: 1 śrīśrīkṛṣṇaḥ atha ṛgvedināṁ madhyāhnasandhyāprayogaḥ gāyatryā śikhāṁ vadhvācamya daśadhā gāyatrīṁ japtvā prathamaṁ kṛtāṅjaliḥ paṭhet oṁkārasya vrahma ṛṣir agnir devatā gā[f. 3r]yatrī chandaḥ sarvvakarmmārambhe viniyogaḥ|F. 19v: iti madhyāhnasandhyāprayogaḥ samāptaḥ atha prātaḥsandhyā|F. 25: iti prātaḥsandhyā atha sāyaṁ sandhyāprayogaḥ|F. 28v: iti sāyaṁ sandhyāprayogaḥ samāptaṁ [f. 29r, strung upside-down] atha śāpoddhāraḥ|F. 31: iti śāpoddhāraḥ atha vyākhyā|F. 32v: atha gāyatrīvar[ṇa?]nyāsaḥ|F. 39v: iti gāyatrīkalpaṁ samāptaṁ|F. 61r: iti tarpaṇavidhiḥ|F. 62r: iti śrīra[--]aghaṭīya[?]śrīraghunandanabhaṭṭācāryyaviracitaṁ tarpaṇavidhiḥ samāptaḥ|F. 68v: iti kṛtāṅjaliḥ atha śrīlāmāhātmyaṁ|F. 75r: iti brahmaviṣṇusamvāde vedavyāsaproktaṁ śilāmāhātmyaṁ samāptaṁ|F. 83r: iti skandapurāṇe harakumārasamvāde śālagrāmaśrīlālakṣaṇaṁ samāptaṁ|End of text illegible due to fading ink, f. 87r.|Colophon, f. 87v: iti japavidhānaḥ iti cāṁ 19 agrahāyaṇa śakābdāḥ 1744 sala 1229 sāla [ṅgjāhay?] idaṁ pustakaṁ sampūrṇaṁ śrīvāmaṇo[----] śarmmanaḥ idaṁ pustakaṁ svahastasya sā[---] śrī durgāyai namaḥ

note: Incomplete manuscript of Rāmotaratāpatiya, presumably a misspelling of Rāmottaratāpanīya [Rāmottaratāpanī], in the Ātharvaṇarahasya [Atharvaṇarahasya]. Title from colophon (f. 11v). Extant folios numbered 4-11.|The number 1914 is provided in the colophon framed by double dandas, which is possibly a date reckoned in saṁvat years.|Written 10 lines per leaf.|Good condition. Double dandas and colophonal invocation in red. Right edge of f. 11 badly worm-eaten. Some worm holes in other folios. Mistakes crossed through with red or covered over with yellow. Marginal corrections.|Manuscript begins (f. 4r): garjadanuvālino vegato guhāt vālis tada[?] nijagāma taṁ vālinam athāhave 23|Ends (f. 11v): oṁ yo vai śrīrāmacaṁdraḥ sa bhagavān yaḥ saccidānaṁdadvaitakāras ātmā bhūr bhūvaḥ svas tasmai vai namo namaḥ 47|Colophon (f. 11v): ity etair vrahmāsaptacatvāriṁśanmaṁtrer nityaṁ devaṁ stauti tasya tasya stuto devaḥ prīto bhavati tasmād varā[?] tair maṁtrair nityaṁ devaṁ stauti sa devaṁ pasyati so 'mṛtatvaṁ ca gachati so mṛtatvaṁ ca gachatīti ity ātharvaṅarahasye rāmotaratāpatiyasamāmptaṁ 1915 śrīrāmacaṁdrāya namaḥ

Lacks beginning and end.|Aṣṭaka 1 (ff. 3-73): lacks beginning. Begins: meghaṁ. juṣanta vahnayaḥ. pāvakā. naḥ sarasvatī. vājebhiḥ. vājinī'vatī. yajñaṁ. vaṣṭu. dhiyā'vasuḥ. codayitrī. Colophon: Iti prathamāṣṭake aṣṭamodhyāyah. Śrīsāmbāryaṇam astu. Idaṁ pustakaṁ Nārāyaṅa Bhaṭṭanene [sic.] iti upanāmakena likhitam. Svārthaṁ parārthaṁ. Śake 1758 plavanāma samvatsare mārgaśīṣaśuddha 3 ravi vāre samāsah. Yādṛśaṁ pustakaṁ dr̥ṣṭvā tādṛśaṁ likhitaṁ mayā. Yadi śuddham aśuddhaṁ vā mama doṣo na vidyate. Tailād raksej[j]alād rakse[c]chitilavandhanāt. Mūrkhahastena dātavyaṁ evaṁ vadati pustakaṁ.|Aṣṭaka 2 (69 leaves) colophon: iti āśvalāyanaśākalapadāyāṁ dvitīyāṣṭaka samāptaḥ... Bhagnapr̥ṣṭikarigrivastabdhadr̥ṣtir adhomukhaṃ. kasṭena likhitaṁ granthaṃ yatnena paripālayet. Nārāyaṅa Bhaṭaneneyena [sic.] likhitaṃ.|Aṣṭaka 3 colophon: iti aśvalāyanapadāyāṁ tr̥tīyāṣṭake aṣṭamodhyāyaḥ. śrī sāmba. bhagnapr̥ṣṭikaṭigrivastabdhadr̥ṣṭir adhomukhaṁ. Kaṣṭena likhitaṁ granthaṁ yatnena paripālayet. Śake 1759 kilakanāma samvatsare caitraśuddha 15 guruvāsare tr̥tīṣṭakasamāptaṁ. yādṛṣaṁ pustakaṁ dr̥ṣṭvā tādṛṣaṁ likhitaṁ mayā. note: Attributed to Viśvāmitrakalpa in colophons ff. [1v, 5v], etc. Title Gāyatrīstavarājastotra appears f. [3v], with alternative title Gāyatrīstavarājamantra on f. 1v. Cataloged by Poleman as two texts: Gaṇapatimālāmantra and Gāyatrīmālāmantra. Appears in New Cat. Cat. under the incorrect titles Gaṇapatimālātantra and Gāyatrīmālātantra.|Written 11 lines per leaf.|Poor condition. Leaves browned and very brittle. Long hole in f. [1] damaging 7 lines of text on each side. Leaves breaking off on edges. Edge of f. [3] broken off, affecting 8 lines of text on each side. Mistakes blotched out with black. Folio enumeration not clearly indicated, hence supplied by cataloger. Ff. [1r-3v], [4] and [5] form independent units.|Begins f. [1r]: śrīgaṇapataye namaḥ asya śrīgāyatrīmālāmantrasya viśvāmitra ṛṣiḥ gāyatrī chandaḥ śrīgāyatrī paramātmā devatā tatsavitur vareṇyaṁ bījaṁ bhargo devasyadhīmahī śaktiḥ dhiyo yonaḥ pracodayāt kīlakaṁ.|Colophon f. [1v]: iti śrīviśvāmitrakalpe gāyatrīmālāmantrasampūrṇaṁ śrīkṛṣṇārpaṇaṁ [om̐?].|Second section (Gāyatrīstavarājastotra) begins (f. [1v]): śrī [om̐] śrīgaṇapataye namaḥ asya śrīgāyatrīstavarājamantrasya nūtanasṛṣṭi kartā viśvāmitra ṛṣiḥ gāyatrī chandaḥ sakalajananī catuṣpadā gāyatrī paramātmā devatā sarvotkṛṣṭ[ ].|Colophon f. [3v]: iti śrīviśvāmitrakalpe g[āyatrī]stavarājastotraṁ sampūrṇaṁ śrīkṛṣṇārpaṇaṁ.|F. [4r] begins: śrīgaṇapataye namaḥ viśvāmitramahāprājñagāyatrīmantra pāragaḥ śrotum ichāmi tatvena gāyatryaṣṭottaraṁ vibho viśvāmitra. sādhu pṛṣṭaṁ tvayā rājan raghuvaṁśakulodbhava gāyatryā caiva sāvitryāḥ sarasvatyāḥ statodhunā.|Colophon f. [4v]: iti viśvāmitrakalpe gāyatryaṣṭottaraśatanāmāmṛtastotraṁ sampūrṇaṁ.|F. [5r] begins: [ ] gaṇapataye namaḥ asya śrīmahāgaṇapatimahāmantrasya gaṇ[e]ṣa ṛṣiḥ nṛcadgāyatrī chandaḥ śrīmahāgaṇapatir devatā mlāṁ bīja[]̇ glīṁ śaktiḥ glūṁ kīlakaṁ.|F. [5v] ends: pūjānte mūrtiṁ [j]ale visarjayet evaṁ kṛte siddhir bhavati nirantaraṁ kṣīrājyamadhubhakṣaṇaṁ kāryam.

note: Tvaritarudravidhāna in the Śāntiratna [Śāntikamalākara] of Kamalākarabhaṭṭa (fl. 1612), which according to the ms. is part of the Kamalākarasaṁgraha [another name for Dharmatattvakamalākara?]. Title from colophon.|Cover folio reads: atha tvaritarudravidhānaprārambhaḥ.|Copied by Bhāskarabhaṭṭa Dāḍekara [Dāṇḍekara?], perhaps in Kāśī (reference made in colophon to the deity Viśveśvara of Kāśī).|Written 10 lines per leaf.|Good condition. Mistakes covered over by yellow. One marginal correction.|Begins (f. 1v): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ. hemādrau. tatra kālaḥ. asiddhir bhūmisampattir maraṇaṁ bandhunāśanaṁ. āyurvṛddhiḥ prajānāśo sapa[tn?]aḥ saṁjayas tathā. śubhaṁ prāptisthānalābhaṁ mokṣam aiśitvaṁ eva ca. caitrādephalāni. kecit āṣāḍho pi śubha uktaḥ.|Ends: asyātha vādastatraiva. kurukṣetre prayāge ca gaṅgāsāgarasaṇgame. mahākāle ca kāśyāṁ ca dīpasthānaṁ na cintayet.|Colophon (f. 14r): iti śrīkamalākarasaṁgrahe śāntiratne tvaritarudravidhānaṁ samāptaṁ. śrīkāśīviśveśvarārpaṇam astu. Yādṛśaṁ pustakaṁ dṛṣṭvā tādṛṣạṁ likhitaṁ mayā. yadi śuddham aśuddhaṁ vā mama doṣo na vidyate. śake 1710 kilaka nāma saṁvatsare caitrakṛṣṇacaturdaśyāṁ ravīvāsare taddine dāḍekaropanāmākhyaṁ bhāskarabhaṭṭena likhitaṁ.|Last folio (f. 14v) reads: : iti tvaritarudravidhānasamāptaḥ.

note: Title from colophon (f. 33v). Cataloged by Poleman as Śivapūjāprakaraṇa. He refers to it as an "abridgment," probably on the basis of the colophon, which describes the text as being compiled (saṁgṛhīta) rather than composed by the author. Title from label is Śivavicāra.|The author, Paramaśivāśrama, is a pupil of Raghunandāśrama (see colophon).|Written 9-17 lines per leaf by multiple hands.|Good condition. Mistakes covered over with yellow, crossed through or blotched out with black. Some mistakes indicated by short vertical strokes above the syllable in question. Several words highlighted in orange. Several marginal additions and many marginal corrections.|Begins: hariḥ om̐. sarvātmā sarvavitsarvaḥ satyajñānasukhādvayāḥ. prapañcopaśamaḥ śāntaḥ śivātmāsmi svabhāvataḥ (verse 1). bodhānandaṁ svarūpaṁ munivaranikaraiḥ sevyamānaṁ maheśaṁ vyākhyāpīṭhe niṣaṇṇaṁ nijajanahṛdaye sarvadā saṁsphurantaṁ. cinmudrām akṣamālāṁ pralayahutavahaṁ pustakaṁ cāruhastair bibhrāṇaṁ suprasannaṁ gurugurum amalaṁ dakṣiṇāmūrtīḍe (verse 2). śivaṁ sāmbaṅgaṇādhyakṣyaṁ guruṁ vāṇīṁ gurum uhuḥ. natvā paramātmavijñānaśivapūjātra varṇyate (verse 3).|Ends: vyākhyāpīṭhe niṣaṇṇaṁ munivaravikaraiḥ sevyamānaṁ maheśaṁ bodhānandasvarūpaṁ nijajanahṛdaye sarvadā saṁsphurantaṁ. cinmudrām akṣamālāṁ pralayahutavahaṁ pustakaṁ cāruhastair vibhrāṇaṁ suprasannaṁ guruvaramaniśaṁ dakṣiṇāmūrtīḍ?e.|Colophon: iti śrīparamahaṁsaparivrājakācāryaśrīraghunandanāśramacaraṇasiṣyena śrīparamaśivāśrameṇa saṁgṛhītaṁ paraātmavicāravijñānaśivapūjāprakaraṇaṁ saṁpūrṇam.

note: Title of super-commentary Bhāṣyaratnaprabhā from colophon (f. 67r); alternate title Śārīrakabhagavatpādabhāṣyaṭīkā from title page; second alternate title Śārīrakamīmāṃsāvyākhyā supplied by cataloger.|Written in 13 lines per leaf.|67 leaves foliated 1-67, upper right verso.|Colophon: iti śrīmatparamahaṃsaparivrājakācāryaśrīgoviṃdānaṃdabhagavatkṛtau śārīrakamīmāṃsāvyākhyāyāṃ bhāṣyaratnaprabhāyāṃ tṛtīyādhyāyasya caturthaḥ pādaḥ // adhyāyaścasamāptaḥ (f. 67r).|Manuscript was originally part of a larger manuscript along with Ms. Coll. 390, Item 1061.|Dated saṃvat 1831 (1774) (Ms. Coll. 390, Item 1061, f. 82v).|Mistakes blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins, some in a second scribal hand; vertical margins marked with double black line.

Ends in verse 29 adhyāya 6. Colophons and introduction of speakers are either in gold lettering outlined by red, or in red. Double daṇḍas are in red. The third and fourth sides of text are surrounded with ornamental devices in gold, purple, and red, and the lines alternate red, gold, black; gold red, black; and black red, gold; black, gold, red. The first and second sides have only three lines per side in red, gold, black and black, gold, and red respectively, and are surrounded by the same ornamental device which is here bordered in black, and surrounded by an ornamental device in tan, gold, and orange on a background of blue and gold with black, gold, and red lines bordering it. Mistakes are covered over with yellow. Orange powder is rubbed in over numbers through folio 10.|Written in 6 lines per leaf.|Non-Latin script record.
